question_stem.en: A 3-day-old boy is brought to the emergency department due to poor feeding, emesis, and lethargy over the past 24 hours. He was born via uncomplicated spontaneous vaginal delivery to a 30-year-old woman who had a normal pregnancy. The boy was discharged from the newborn nursery yesterday and was breastfeeding exclusively until the onset of symptoms. Stool and urine output were normal while he was in the hospital. The patient is afebrile and normotensive but tachycardic and tachypneic. He appears dehydrated, and the abdomen is distended. The patient vomits during the examination; the vomitus is shown in the exhibit {{exhibit_1}}. On laparotomy, fibrous bands are seen extending from the cecum and right colon to the retroperitoneum, causing extrinsic compression of the duodenum.
question_stem.zh: 一名 3 天大的男孩因过去 24 小时内喂养不良、呕吐和嗜睡被送往急诊科。 他出生于 30 岁女性的无并发症的自然阴道分娩，该女性妊娠正常。 昨天，这名男孩从新生儿病房出院，并且在出现症状前一直纯母乳喂养。 在住院期间，大便和尿量正常。 患者无发热，血压正常，但心动过速和呼吸急促。 他看起来脱水，腹部膨胀。 患者在检查期间呕吐；呕吐物如{{exhibit_1}}所示。 在剖腹探查术中，可见纤维带从盲肠和右结肠延伸至腹膜后，导致十二指肠外压迫。

question.en: Which of the following embryologic processes most likely failed in this patient?
question.zh: 该患者最有可能发生以下哪种胚胎学过程失败？

A.en: Fusion of the ventral and dorsal pancreatic buds
A.zh: 腹侧和背侧胰芽的融合

C.en: Neural crest cell migration into the bowel wall
C.zh: 神经嵴细胞迁移到肠壁

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of embryological development of the midgut and the clinical presentation of midgut malrotation. It also tests the ability to differentiate midgut malrotation from other causes of bilious emesis in a newborn. 

To solve this question, recognize the clinical presentation of bilious emesis and abdominal distension in a newborn. The presence of Ladd bands on laparotomy is pathognomonic for midgut malrotation, which results from incomplete counterclockwise rotation of the midgut during embryological development.
summary.zh:
此题考察了中肠的胚胎发育知识以及中肠旋转不良的临床表现。 它还测试了将中肠旋转不良与新生儿胆汁性呕吐的其他原因区分开来的能力。

要解决这个问题，需要认识到新生儿胆汁性呕吐和腹胀的临床表现。 剖腹探查术中存在 Ladd 束是中肠旋转不良的特征性表现，中肠旋转不良是由于胚胎发育过程中中肠逆时针旋转不完全所致。

tags: Midgut malrotation; Embryology; Intestinal obstruction; Ladd bands; Bilious emesis; Newborn; Surgical intervention; Gastrointestinal system
